notes.text:
An update for rh-ruby27-ruby is now available for Red Hat Software Collections.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Ruby is an extensible, interpreted, object-oriented, scripting language. It has features to process text files and to perform system management tasks. 

The following packages have been upgraded to a later upstream version: rh-ruby27-ruby (2.7.8). (BZ#2149267)

Security Fix(es):

* ruby/cgi-gem: HTTP response splitting in CGI (CVE-2021-33621)

* ruby: ReDoS vulnerability in URI (CVE-2023-28755)

* ruby: ReDoS vulnerability in Time (CVE-2023-28756)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of CRLF Sequences in HTTP Headers ('HTTP Request/Response Splitting')

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in Ruby that allows HTTP header injection. A CGI application using the CGI library may insert untrusted input into the HTTP response header. This issue can allow an attacker to insert a newline character to split a header and inject malicious content to deceive clients.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ruby/cgi-gem: HTTP response splitting in CGI
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This vulnerability is marked as moderate because the flaw was more difficult to exploit but could still lead to some compromise of the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of resources under certain circumstances but are less easily exploited based on a technical evaluation of the flaw, or affect unlikely configurations.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: ruby/cgi-gem: HTTP response splitting in CGI

notes.text: A flaw was found in the rubygem URI. The URI parser mishandles invalid URLs that have specific characters, which causes an increase in execution time parsing strings to URI objects. This may result in a regular expression denial of service (ReDoS).
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Time gem and Time library of Ruby. The Time parser mishandles invalid strings with specific characters and causes an increase in execution time for parsing strings to Time objects. This issue may result in a Regular expression denial of service (ReDoS).
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
